content.description: Go up a nice panel of south-facing rock using good pockets. This route was originally listed in Hanson's guidebook as a toprope route called Fairy Princess (5.9), but after soloing it, I thought it made more sense to list it here as a boulder problem. It's tall for a boulder and short for a route, so call it what you will. Either way, it's a fun little bit of climbing!
content.protection: Pads are probably the best way to protect this little route.
content.location: It is on the south-facing wall just north of the block.

content.description: Climb up to a ledge then ascend the crack.  This mainly provides an easy way to the top of the block.
content.location: Crack on the north side of the block.  To descend, either downclimb the route or rap (may need some rap links) off the sport route on the northeast side.

content.description:
This is a fun, clean chimney east of the other routes. The chimney has various widths from tight chimney to wide stemming, so different variations may have differing grades. It's very similar to the

Banana Chimney

but perhaps a bit easier.
content.protection: None. A toprope would likely require some creativity or long static ropes.
content.location: It is East of the main Corporate View Block.

pathTokens: Denver Metropolitan Area Bouldering and Buildering
